sudo apt-get clean
theres computer-janitor too
uninstall apps you dont need
could ditch openoffice (500Mb) and install abiword (10Mb) and gnumeric (12Mb)
you can also run: dpkg -l | grep linux-image    and uninstall old unused kernels
could also remove gimp if you dont use it
you need to clear space, some apps you wont use and can be removed
the system holds onto all the old kernels which are about ~100Mb per kernel
you can see your  current kernel with: uname -r    DO NOT delete that one
if you run: sudo apt-get --purge remove linux-image-<some numbers here-generic
no problem, those are the modules for each kernel
you should also run: sudo apt-get --purge autoremove
